STATIC_heading.text: REVIEW SHEET

STATIC_text.text: Write the meanings of the combining forms in the spaces provided and test yourself. Check your answers with the information in the chapter or in the Glossary (Medical Word Parts—English) at the end of the book.
Instructions: Click or tap on the plus sign to reveal the opposite side of the card.

header.title: aden/o

readingPart.reading: gland

header.title: alveol/o

readingPart.reading: alveolus; air sac; small sac

header.title: cac/o

readingPart.reading: bad

header.title: carcin/o

readingPart.reading: cancerous; cancer

header.title: cry/o

readingPart.reading: cold

header.title: follicul/o

readingPart.reading: follicle; small sac

header.title: fung/i

readingPart.reading: fungus; mushroom (lower organism lacking chlorophyll)

header.title: medull/o

readingPart.reading: medulla (inner section); middle; soft, marrow

header.title: mucos/o

readingPart.reading: mucous membrane (mucosa)

header.title: mut/a

readingPart.reading: genetic change

header.title: mutagen/o

readingPart.reading: causing genetic change

header.title: necr/o

readingPart.reading: death

header.title: neur/o

readingPart.reading: nerve

header.title: onc/o

readingPart.reading: tumor

header.title: papill/o

readingPart.reading: nipple-like; optic disc (disk)

header.title: pharmac/o

readingPart.reading: drug

header.title: plas/o

readingPart.reading: development; formation; growth

header.title: ple/o

readingPart.reading: more; many; varied

header.title: polyp/o

readingPart.reading: polyp; small growth

header.title: radi/o

readingPart.reading: x-rays; radioactivity; radius (lateral lower arm bone)

header.title: sarc/o

readingPart.reading: flesh (connective tissue)

header.title: scirrh/o

readingPart.reading: hard

header.title: xer/o

readingPart.reading: dry

header.title: -ary

readingPart.reading: pertaining to

header.title: -blastoma

readingPart.reading: immature tumor (cells)

header.title: -oid

readingPart.reading: resembling; originating from

header.title: -oma

readingPart.reading: tumor; mass; fluid collection

header.title: -plasia

readingPart.reading: development; formation; growth

header.title: -plasm

readingPart.reading: formation; structure

header.title: -ptosis

readingPart.reading: falling; drooping; prolapse

header.title: -stasis

readingPart.reading: stopping; controlling; placing

header.title: -stomia

readingPart.reading: condition of the mouth

header.title: -suppression

readingPart.reading: stopping

header.title: -therapy

readingPart.reading: treatment

header.title: -tion

readingPart.reading: process

header.title: ana-

readingPart.reading: up; apart; backward; again, anew

header.title: anti-

readingPart.reading: against

header.title: apo-

readingPart.reading: off, away

header.title: brachy-

readingPart.reading: short

header.title: dys-

readingPart.reading: bad; painful; difficult; abnormal

header.title: epi-

readingPart.reading: above; upon; on

header.title: hyper-

readingPart.reading: above; excessive

header.title: meta-

readingPart.reading: change; beyond

header.title: tele-

readingPart.reading: far

questionContent.questionText:
1. Cancerous tumor composed of cells of epithelial origin

[carcinoma]

2. Drug treatment given after primary treatment

[adjuvant chemotherapy]

3. Detailed plan of treatment

[protocol]

4. Study using CT scan or MRI to map the area to receive treatment before radiation therapy

[simulation]

5. Wide and complete resection of tumor in a cavity of the body

[exenteration]

6. Cancerous tumor derived from connective (flesh) tissue

[sarcoma]

7. Chemicals in the blood that measure the presence of tumor in the body

[protein markers]

8. General ill health and malnutrition associated with disease

[cachexia]

9. Teletherapy

[external beam radiotherapy]

10. Insertion of radioactive seeds or sealed containers into tumor

[brachytherapy]

11. Malignancy that is localized and not invasive

[carcinoma in situ]

12. Cancerous tumor that has spread to lymph nodes and other organs

[metastasis]

13. Stopping the growth of cells in the bone marrow

[myelosuppression]

14. Extraction of cells for microscopic (biopsy) evaluation

[fine needle aspiration]

instructions.instructions: Write the terms used in cancer medicine next to their meanings below.

STATIC_text.text: Please visit the Evolve website for additional exercises, games, and images related to this chapter.
